title: Defi Credit Union Via Crowd-staking
description: Most access to credit in Africa is done via traditional credit unions, which is limited by factors like; Trust, Familiarity & Capital risk.

title: CheCha - With ADA Wallets
description: Zimbabweans have insufficient small change USD cash to match the purchases of goods or services, CheCha was developed to solve that

title: Lending platform for africans
description: Cash flow to conduct  business is a big issue for less wealthy people in africa. Loans are difficult to get and with high interest rates

title: Scaling up Tontine
description: Tontine is a popular way usually for women to raise money for micro-business but they hardly scale up to more than a few tens of people.

title: Distributed Income Share Agreements
description: Financing for higher education is scarce in lower-income countries where a range of economic factors have eroded creditor confidence

title: Green Lion (GL) lending in Ghana
description: The informal sector in Ghana stagnates / expands slowly because there are no low cost, efficient, reliable borrowing options

title: Direct Donation for Education
description: Current donation services lack efficiency, transparency and security. ADA microlending may be difficult due to legal barriers and trust.

title: Helping African Social Savers
description: Social savings circles known by dozens of names across Africa lack digitized records and credit checks for their members.
